CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 2, 1968, pg. 13 reads: "Steel City Golfers - Pittsburgh's newest sports organization, the Steel City Golf Club, will make its social bow at a gala "Sweater Ball" on Sunday, March 24, in the ballroom of the Hilton Hotel. Starting at 7:30, there will be a battle of music between two popular bands, the Bobby Jones Organ group and The Elegants.  Prizes will be awarded for the most attractive sweater worn by a woman and man.  Members of the club are pictured from left: William Browne, Bob Lane, "Boots" Parker, "Sir Walter" Christian, Bobby Jones, Jimmy Dyer and Walt Mangham. (Harris Photo)
TitMainTitle: Two men, including John "Sir Walter" Christian wearing cardigan embroidered "SCG," and woman wearing sleeveless sweater tunic, standing in Hilton Hotel for Steel City Golf Club Sweater Ball
